New Records: Greece secured their first-ever win against England in a Nations League match
Key Match Events: England lacked control and authority in midfield while being porous at the back, allowing Greece to tear through them with increasing regularity
Vangelis Pavlidis scored the opening goal for Greece in the 49th minute
Bellingham scored a side-footed curler past Odysseas Vlachodimos to equalize
Levi Colwill and Rico Lewis got in each other's way, allowing Pavlidis to drive home the last-gasp winner
Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley loaded his starting England XI with Jude Bellingham, Phil Foden, and Cole Palmer in central areas, aiming to have the ball and make things happen
Carsley's approach was bold and fluid, marked by a 4-2-4 formation with asterisks
Post-Match Reflections: Lee Carsley was 'hopeful' of returning to the England Under-21s after the defeat
The Greece players dedicated their historic win to George Baldock, the England-born Greece international who drowned in a swimming pool at his home in Athens
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jordan Pickford had an erratic performance, leaving his area to try to spark a move but being robbed and making a spectacular goalline clearance
England enjoyed some rewards when they brought a high press, panicking Greece into errors
Others: The match was played at Wembley, and the Greece players celebrated their country's first win against England by paying tribute to George Baldock on the pitch
